Your courses will require a combination of different learning formats, including lectures, tutorials, workshops, seminars and practicals. Aside from your classes, you’ll also need to allocate additional time for independent study. This may include assignments, readings, projects and contributing to online discussion forums. As a rough guide, full-time studies may require 12-26 hours of class time and 14-18 hours of independent study per week. 
 
Assessment
During your studies at Adelaide University, you’ll complete a mixture of practical, professional and research-based learning. Your assessment types will vary depending on the degree you’re studying, but may include:

[CARD]
Design a study path that works for you
This degree is part of a stackable set of qualifications, meaning your study choices are flexible. If your goals shift, you can exit after six months of study with a standalone Graduate Certificate or after one year with a Graduate Diploma qualification. 
You can also begin your studies with a shorter qualification like the six-month Graduate Certificate and continue on to complete the Graduate Diploma (one year) or full master’s degree.
[CARD]
Course name
Course code
Units
Complete 36 units for ALL of the following:
[CARD]
Course name
Course code
Units
Complete 12 units for ALL of the following:
[CARD]
Level 5 Civil Electives
Complete 48 units comprising:24 units from Level 5 Civil Electives, and24 units from Level 6 Civil Electives
[CARD]
Expand all
Applications for Australian students to study at Adelaide University will open in August 2025. Applications will be via SATAC for most undergraduate and postgraduate coursework programs. 
Applications to study a 100% online degree will open in July 2025 via a direct application process. 
In the meantime, you could start your studies at UniSA or the University of Adelaide in 2025 and continue on to Adelaide University in 2026.
[CARD]
Applications for Australian students to study at Adelaide University will open in August 2025. Applications will be via SATAC for most undergraduate and postgraduate coursework programs. 
Applications to study a 100% online degree will open in July 2025 via a direct application process. 
In the meantime, you could start your studies at UniSA or the University of Adelaide in 2025 and continue on to Adelaide University in 2026.
[CARD]
Adelaide University is South Australia’s largest university with seven campuses across the state. Adelaide City Campus is in the heart of the central business district (including eastern and western precincts), while our Magill, Mawson Lakes and Waite campuses are located within the inner suburbs of Adelaide. Our Mount Gambier, Roseworthy and Whyalla campuses are set in the regions of South Australia. Building on our digital and online learning successes, we aim to also deliver online education to more students than any other Australian university. 
Each of our campuses is equipped with cutting-edge, discipline specific facilities, contemporary study spaces and well-resourced libraries. Our city and suburban campuses also feature on-site gyms and eateries, and health services on, or nearby, campus. 
You will be well supported academically, socially, emotionally and spiritually with access to on-campus facilities and services such as counselling, learning support, childcare, prayer rooms and more.
[CARD]
You will be well supported through a range of services at Adelaide University to ensure you get the most out of your student experience. Support services include:
Academic learning support, spanning assistance with writing, referencing, mathematics and more.
Advice and advocacy regarding access, adjustments and inclusivity if you have a disability, impairment, chronic health condition or significant caring responsibilities. 
Libraries providing flexible study spaces, access to books, computer suites and online resources – as well as referencing support, search tips and more.Career development hub, including extensive self-help resources, online learning programs, on-campus events, workshops and networking, one-on-one advice, and job search support.Qualified counsellors who can provide confidential support to manage your mental health and wellbeing.
On-campus medical clinics on-site where you can make an appointment with a General Practitioner to discuss acute and preventative health care matters.Information and advice for international students regarding accommodation, student life, and academic policies and procedures.An active and visible LGBTIQA+ Ally Network that ensures the University provides a supportive environment where all staff and students can safely work and study free of harassment or discrimination.
Prayer rooms on campus, including gender specific spaces for worship purposes.
Campus security available 24 hours a day, seven days a week to ensure all students feel safe on campus.A range of scholarships offered to commencing and continuing students each year to make university life a little easier.A number of social outlets including student lounges, gyms, student-led clubs, sports teams and free events throughout the year.
[CARD]
Your tuition fees will depend on your program of study and enrolment load. You can find the annual fees relevant to your program on the specific degree page under the ‘fees’ section. The annual fee payable for your chosen program will also be outlined in your Offer of Admission.
[CARD]
Adelaide University will open in January 2026. Your studies will start at different times depending on what study period you’ve applied for. Adelaide University is currently using a semester model, which means most degrees start in Semester 1. Some degrees are also available to start in mid-year, sometimes with a different degree structure. 
Studies at Adelaide University typically commence in:  
February for Semester 1  July for Semester 2. 
Some degrees, such as the Bachelor of Medical Studies and Master of Business Administration, will have different starting dates. View the relevant degree page for more detail. 
For other key dates, including census dates and exam periods, you can view the Academic calendar.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Apply now – international students
[HEADING] Ready to apply? We’re here to help
[HEADING] Before you apply
[HEADING] Prepare your documentation
[HEADING] Check the application closing date for your chosen degree
[HEADING] Review any additional academic entry requirements
[HEADING] Learn about English language requirements
[HEADING] Apply now
[HEADING] Applications requiring an Education Agent
[HEADING] Applications without an Education Agent
[HEADING] Next steps
[HEADING] Accepting your offer
You’ve chosen your degree – now it’s time to apply!
Whether you’re preparing your application yourself or applying through one of our authorised Education Agents, we’re here to help at every step.
All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
We’ve put together the information below to help you prepare, submit and track your application status.
You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.
Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree.
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.
It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.
International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)
A copy of your passport.
Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have
Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test
Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).
You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent.
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East
North Africa
Sub-Saharan Africa
South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)
Philippines
Latin America.
Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.
If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application.
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment.
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks.
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.
Find out how to accept your offer and next steps.
• Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)
• A copy of your passport.
• Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have
• Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test
• Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).
• The Middle East
• North Africa
• Sub-Saharan Africa
• South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)
• Philippines
• Latin America.

Whether you’re preparing your application yourself or applying through one of our authorised Education Agents, we’re here to help at every step. 
All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University. 
We’ve put together the information below to help you prepare, submit and track your application status.




Apply now

















Before you apply







Expand all









Prepare your documentation 










You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.












Check the application closing date for your chosen degree 








Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree. 
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree 










Review any additional academic entry requirements 








It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.



















Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.













        Accepting your offer 
    
Find out how to accept your offer and next steps.

We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.













        Accepting your offer 
    
Find out how to accept your offer and next steps.

Ready to apply? We’re here to help
You’ve chosen your degree – now it’s time to apply!
Whether you’re preparing your application yourself or applying through one of our authorised Education Agents, we’re here to help at every step. 
All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University. 
We’ve put together the information below to help you prepare, submit and track your application status.




Apply now

















Before you apply







Expand all









Prepare your documentation 










You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.












Check the application closing date for your chosen degree 








Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree. 
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree 










Review any additional academic entry requirements 








It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.



















Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all

The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.
Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Ready to apply? We’re here to help
You’ve chosen your degree – now it’s time to apply!
Whether you’re preparing your application yourself or applying through one of our authorised Education Agents, we’re here to help at every step. 
All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University. 
We’ve put together the information below to help you prepare, submit and track your application status.




Apply now

















Before you apply







Expand all









Prepare your documentation 










You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.












Check the application closing date for your chosen degree 








Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree. 
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree 










Review any additional academic entry requirements 








It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.



















Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Check the application closing date for your chosen degree 








Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree. 
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree 










Review any additional academic entry requirements 








It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.

Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.












Check the application closing date for your chosen degree 








Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree. 
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree 










Review any additional academic entry requirements 








It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.

Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Ready to apply? We’re here to help
You’ve chosen your degree – now it’s time to apply!
Whether you’re preparing your application yourself or applying through one of our authorised Education Agents, we’re here to help at every step. 
All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University. 
We’ve put together the information below to help you prepare, submit and track your application status.




Apply now

If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.












Check the application closing date for your chosen degree

Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree

It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.

If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.

If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.

Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.
Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).

The Middle East

Philippines

Latin America.

Ready to apply? We’re here to help
You’ve chosen your degree – now it’s time to apply!
Whether you’re preparing your application yourself or applying through one of our authorised Education Agents, we’re here to help at every step. 
All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University. 
We’ve put together the information below to help you prepare, submit and track your application status.




Apply now
Ready to apply? We’re here to help
You’ve chosen your degree – now it’s time to apply!
Whether you’re preparing your application yourself or applying through one of our authorised Education Agents, we’re here to help at every step. 
All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University. 
We’ve put together the information below to help you prepare, submit and track your application status.




Apply now
Before you apply







Expand all









Prepare your documentation 










You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.












Check the application closing date for your chosen degree 








Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree. 
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree 










Review any additional academic entry requirements 








It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.

Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.

Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.
[CARD]
You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.
[CARD]
If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.
[CARD]
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.

Apply now to become a student at Adelaide University and embark on your future career.
It is quick and easy to submit your application.
Once you have registered you can:
Edit and save your application as often as you want, before you submitReceive status updates and track the progress of your application any timeAccept, defer or decline your offer

pages.content:
[HEADING] How to apply – international students
[HEADING] International student applications to Adelaide University
[HEADING] Research degree students
[HEADING] Before you begin
[HEADING] Our three-step application guide
[HEADING] Step 1 – Determine your application process
[HEADING] Applying through an Education Agent
[HEADING] Applying directly
[HEADING] Step 2 – Assessment of your application
[HEADING] Step 3 – Accept your offer
If you’re an international student, applications to study with us are open now. Whatever your starting point, we’re here to guide you through our application process.
If you’re interested in studying a research degree, applications are open now. Follow our step-by-step guide and apply.
Find the degree you want to apply for and make sure you meet the following:
Academic entry requirements
English language requirements
Genuine Student requirement
Financial capacity requirement.
For more information about these requirements, visit the international entry requirements webpage.
Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
If you’re not eligible for direct entry, you may be eligible to study with one of our pathway providers and receive a packaged offer to gain entry to Adelaide University.
You can apply through one of Adelaide University’s Education Agents or directly via our Online Application System.
You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East
North Africa
Sub-Saharan Africa
South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)
Philippines
Latin America.
If you’re applying without an Education Agent you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment.
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks.
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
Successful applicants will receive the following:
Offer of Admission
Acceptance Form
Terms and Conditions of Acceptance
Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions
Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.
Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.
Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System.
Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.
Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).
Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.
If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.
*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.
• Academic entry requirements
• English language requirements
• Genuine Student requirement
• Financial capacity requirement.
• The Middle East
• North Africa
• Sub-Saharan Africa
• South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)
• Philippines
• Latin America.

• Acceptance Form
• Terms and Conditions of Acceptance
• Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions
• Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).
• Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.
• Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.
• Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System.
• Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.
• Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).
• Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.
[GRID_TABLE]
How to apply – international students
    




Apply now
View entry requirements




















Show menu









International student applications to Adelaide University 
If you’re an international student, applications to study with us are open now. Whatever your starting point, we’re here to guide you through our application process. 













        Research degree students
    
If you’re interested in studying a research degree, applications are open now. Follow our step-by-step guide and apply. 



        Apply as a research degree student















Before you begin  
Find the degree you want to apply for and make sure you meet the following:  
Academic entry requirements  

English language requirements  

Genuine Student requirement   

Financial capacity requirement.   

For more information about these requirements, visit the international entry requirements webpage.   

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
If you’re not eligible for direct entry, you may be eligible to study with one of our pathway providers and receive a packaged offer to gain entry to Adelaide University.







Our three-step application guide













        Step 1 – Determine your application process 
    
You can apply through one of Adelaide University’s Education Agents or directly via our Online Application System.















        Applying through an Education Agent  
    
You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.   
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




        Find an Education Agent near you  










        Applying directly 
    
If you’re applying without an Education Agent you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System. 



        Online Application System


























        Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).  






















        Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System. 











More information on accepting your offer



















*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).

Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.

Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions

Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.

Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).

Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.

International student applications to Adelaide University 
If you’re an international student, applications to study with us are open now. Whatever your starting point, we’re here to guide you through our application process. 













        Research degree students
    
If you’re interested in studying a research degree, applications are open now. Follow our step-by-step guide and apply. 



        Apply as a research degree student















Before you begin  
Find the degree you want to apply for and make sure you meet the following:  
Academic entry requirements  

English language requirements  

Genuine Student requirement   

Financial capacity requirement.   

For more information about these requirements, visit the international entry requirements webpage.   

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
If you’re not eligible for direct entry, you may be eligible to study with one of our pathway providers and receive a packaged offer to gain entry to Adelaide University.







Our three-step application guide













        Step 1 – Determine your application process 
    
You can apply through one of Adelaide University’s Education Agents or directly via our Online Application System.















        Applying through an Education Agent  
    
You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.   
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




        Find an Education Agent near you  










        Applying directly 
    
If you’re applying without an Education Agent you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System. 



        Online Application System


























        Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).  






















        Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System. 











More information on accepting your offer



















*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.
